intro: Willdenowia affinis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its native habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Willdenowia affinis thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-draining soil.
